title: Case 1: Chest Pain
doctorStem: You are a GP trainee in a busy practice. A 45-year-old man, Mr. James Mitchell, has been booked in for an urgent appointment. The receptionist notes he called this morning complaining of chest pain.

caseNotes.medications: Ramipril 5mg once daily, Atorvastatin 20mg once daily
caseNotes.socialHistory: Works as office manager. Smokes 20 cigarettes/day for 25 years. Drinks 15-20 units alcohol/week. Lives with wife and two children.
caseNotes.familyHistory: Father had MI at age 55. Mother has type 2 diabetes.

actorInformation.openingStatement: Doctor, I've been having this chest pain since this morning. It's really worrying me.

freelyGivenHistory.presentingComplaint: Central chest pain started 2 hours ago. Describes as 'tight' and 'heavy' feeling. Came on while sitting at his desk at work.
freelyGivenHistory.psychosocialImpact: Very anxious about the pain. Worried it might be his heart. Says he can't concentrate at work.
freelyGivenHistory.ideasConcernsExpectations: Thinks it might be a heart attack. Wants to know if he needs to go to hospital. Expects some tests to be done.

presentingComplaint.radiation: Radiates to left arm and jaw
presentingComplaint.onset: Started 2 hours ago, came on gradually over 5 minutes
presentingComplaint.duration: Constant since onset, but severity varies
presentingComplaint.associatedSymptoms: Mild shortness of breath, feeling nauseous, slight dizziness

pastMedicalHistory.hypertension: Diagnosed 2 years ago, well controlled on Ramipril. Last BP check 3 months ago was 138/85.
pastMedicalHistory.cholesterol: High cholesterol diagnosed same time as hypertension. On Atorvastatin. Last check 6 months ago was 5.2.
pastMedicalHistory.otherConditions: No diabetes, no known heart disease, no previous chest pain episodes

drugHistory.overTheCounter: Takes occasional ibuprofen for headaches (maybe 2-3 times per month)
drugHistory.compliance: Takes medications regularly, last dose this morning

socialHistory.work: Office manager, sedentary job, works 9-5 Monday to Friday
socialHistory.family: Married with two children (ages 12 and 15). Wife works part-time.
socialHistory.livingSituation: Lives in own house with family
socialHistory.smoking: Smokes 20 cigarettes per day for 25 years (25 pack-years). Tried to quit twice but unsuccessful.
socialHistory.alcohol: Drinks 15-20 units per week, mostly at weekends. No history of alcohol-related problems.
socialHistory.diet: Eats mostly convenience food due to busy lifestyle
socialHistory.exercise: Minimal exercise, walks to work (10 minutes) but otherwise sedentary

familyHistory.cardiovascular: Father had myocardial infarction at age 55. Mother has type 2 diabetes (diagnosed age 60).

domain1.title: Domain 1: Data Gathering & Interpretation
items: Explored site, radiation, character, severity of pain
Asked about onset, duration, exacerbating/relieving factors
Obtained family history (father's MI, mother's diabetes)

domain2.title: Domain 2: Clinical Management (Weighted 1.5x)
items: Assessed cardiovascular risk (smoking, FH, age, hypertension)
Considered need for urgent referral (if indicated)

domain3.title: Domain 3: Interpersonal Skills
items: Used appropriate language and avoided jargon
